object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BackhaulSta.
object.description: Contains the Medium Access Control (MAC) address of the STA on this radio providing Wi-Fi backhaul to this device.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the logical STA sharing the radio for Wi-Fi backhaul.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ScanCapability.
object.description: This object describes the channel scan capabilities of a radio.

parameter.name: OnBootOnly
parameter.description: On boot only flag, Indicates whether the specified radio is capable only of On boot scans.

parameter.name: Impact
parameter.description:
Scan Impact of using this radio to perform a scan.
: 1: No impact,
: 2: Reduced number of spatial streams,
: 3: Time slicing impairment,
: 4: Radio unavailable for >= 2 seconds.

parameter.name: MinimumInterval
parameter.description: Minimum Scan Interval, the minimum interval in {{units}} between the start of two consecutive channel scans on this radio.

parameter.name: OpClassChannelsNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.ScanCapability.OpClassChannels.{i}.
object.description: Table of the operating classes (selected from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}) and channel numbers in each operating class that the radio is capable of scanning.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: {{list}} The channel numbers in this Operating Class which the radio is capable of scanning.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.CACCapability.
object.description: This object describes the Channel Availability Check (CAC) capabilities of a radio.

parameter.name: CACMethodNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.CACCapability.CACMethod.{i}.
object.description: List of Channel Availability Check (CAC) method information for each type of CAC that the radio can perform. Each type is defined by a method and time to complete. For each type, the classes and channels allowed are enumerated.

parameter.name: Method
parameter.description:
CAC method supported;
: 0: Continuous CAC,
: 1: Continuous with dedicated radio,
: 2: Multi-Input Multi-Output (MIMO) dimension reduced,
: 3: Time sliced CAC.

parameter.name: NumberOfSeconds
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} required to complete this method of CAC.

parameter.name: OpClassChannelsNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.CACCapability.CACMethod.{i}.OpClassChannels.{i}.
object.description: Table of the operating classes (selected from {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}) and channel numbers in each operating class supported for this method of CAC.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: {{list}} The channel numbers in this Operating Class that are supported for this method of CAC.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.
object.description: This object represents the capabilities of the radio which may be different from the current operational configuration.

parameter.name: HTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the HT capabilities of the radio as defined by the HTCapabilities TLV {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.8}}.

parameter.name: VHTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the VHT capabilities of the radio as defined by the VHTCapabilities TLV {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.9}}.

parameter.name: HECapabilities
MSCSCapability
parameter.description: This parameter indicates support for Mirrored Stream Classification Service (MSCS) and EasyMesh configuration of MSCS {{bibref|EasyMesh|AP Radio Advanced Capabilities TLV}}.

parameter.name: SCSCapability
parameter.description: This parameter indicates support for Stream Classification Service (SCS) and EasyMesh {{bibref|EasyMesh}} configuration of SCS {{bibref|EasyMesh|AP Radio Advanced Capabilities TLV}}.

parameter.name: QoSMapCapability
parameter.description: This parameter indicates support for QoS Map {{bibref|EasyMesh|AP Radio Advanced Capabilities TLV}}.

parameter.name: DSCPPolicyCapability
parameter.description: This parameter indicates support for DSCP Mapping Table TLV based DSCP-to-UP mapping and EasyMesh distribution of QoS Map elements to associated STAs {{bibref|EasyMesh|AP Radio Advanced Capabilities TLV}}.

parameter.name: SCSTrafficDescriptionCapability
parameter.description: This parameter indicates support for QoS Management Stream Classification Service (SCS) Traffic Description and EasyMesh configuration of and/or extensions to SCS using traffic descriptions {{bibref|EasyMesh|AP Radio Advanced Capabilities TLV}}.

parameter.name: CapableOperatingClassProfileNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AKMFrontHaulNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: AKMBackhaulNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi6APRole.
object.description: Describes the Wi-Fi 6 capabilities for the AP role.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi6bSTARole.
object.description: Describes the Wi-Fi 6 capabilities for the backhaul Station (bSTA) role.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7APRole.
object.description: This object describes the Wi-Fi 7 capabilities for the AP role including Multi-Link Operation (MLO) capabilities. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7APRole.EMLMRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Enhanced Multi-Link Multi-Radio (EMLMR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7APRole.EMLSRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Enhanced Multi-Link Single-Radio (EMLSR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7APRole.STRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Simultaneous Transmit and Receive (STR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7APRole.NSTRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Non-Simultaneous Transmit and Receive (NSTR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7bSTARole.
object.description: This object describes the Wi-Fi 7 capabilities for the backhaul Station (bSTA) role including Multi-Link Operation (MLO) capabilities. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7bSTARole.EMLMRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Enhanced Multi-Link Multi-Radio (EMLMR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7bSTARole.EMLSRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Enhanced Multi-Link Single-Radio (EMLSR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7bSTARole.STRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Simultaneous Transmit and Receive (STR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.WiFi7bSTARole.NSTRFreqSeparation.{i}.
object.description: This object describes the required frequency separation from the specified radio {{param|RUID}} for MLO Non-Simultaneous Transmit and Receive (NSTR) operation. {{bibref|EasyMesh}} Source: Wi-Fi 7 Agent Capabilities TLV.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.AKMFrontHaul.{i}.
object.description: Authentication and Key Management (AKM) Suite (security mode) capabilities for the fronthaul BSS.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.AKMBackhaul.{i}.
object.description: Authentication and Key Management (AKM) Suite (security mode) capabilities for the backhaul BSS.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.Capabilities.CapableOperatingClassProfile.{i}.
object.description: Describes one of the possible Operating Classes supported by this Radio.

parameter.name: Class
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} that this radio is capable of operating on.

parameter.name: MaxTxPower
parameter.description:
Maximum Transmit Power EIRP that this radio is capable of transmitting in the current regulatory domain for the Operating Class.
Represented as 2's complement signed integer in units of decibels relative to 1 mW ({{units}}).

parameter.name: NonOperable
parameter.description:
{{list}} The channel numbers which are statically non-operable in the Operating Class (i.e. the Radio is never able to operate on these channels).
Other channels from this Operating Class which are not listed here are supported for the Radio.

parameter.name: NumberOfNonOperChan
parameter.description: The number of non-operable channels contained in {{param|NonOperable}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.CurrentOperatingClassProfile.{i}.
object.description:
Describes one of the current Operating Classes in use by this Radio. One Operating Class is indicated for each current Operating Channel Bandwidth.
The Channel indicated for the 20 MHz Operating Class is equal to the current primary channel.

parameter.name: Class
parameter.description: The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} that this radio is currently operating on.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: This Channel number in the Operating Class that this Radio is currently operating on.

parameter.name: TxPower
parameter.description:
Nominal Transmit Power EIRP that this radio is currently using for the current Channel in the Opeating Class.
Represented as 2's complement signed integer in units of decibels relative to 1 mW ({{units}}).

parameter.name: TransmitPowerLimit
parameter.description: This is the upper limit on nominal transmit Equivalent Isotropically Radiated Power (EIRP) that this radio is allowed to use for the current {{param|Class}}. In units of decibels relative to 1 mW {{units}}.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.DisAllowedOpClassChannels.{i}.
object.description: The operating classes, and list of channels for each operating class, which are not allowed to be used on this radio.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables disallowed operating classes and channels.

parameter.name: OpClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.
Note that the operating class identifies the band and channel width.

parameter.name: ChannelList
parameter.description: {{list}} The channel numbers in this Operating Class that are not allowed to be used on this radio.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.SpatialReuse.
object.description:
The spatial reuse configuration of this radio. Applies only to Wi-Fi 6 {{bibref|802.11ax}} and possibly later generations of radios.
Acronyms: Spatial Reuse Group (SRG), Overlapping Basic Service Set (OBSS), Preamble Detection (PD).

parameter.name: PartialBSSColor
parameter.description: The value of the Partial Basic Service Set (BSS) Color subfield of the HEOperations.BSSColorInformation field being transmitted by BSSs operating on this radio. (EasyMesh TLV Field: Partial BSS Color)

parameter.name: NeighborBSSColorInUseBitmap
parameter.description: Bitmap of BSS colors of Overlapping BSSs (OBSSs) that the High-Efficiency (HE) AP has identified by itself or via the autonomous BSS Color collision reports received from associated non-AP HE STAs.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.
object.description: A single logical BSS operating on this radio.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description:
The MAC Address of the logical BSS (BSSID).
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.BSSID}}.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description:
The SSID in use for this BSS.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.SSID}}.

parameter.name: Enabled
parameter.description:
Whether the BSSID is currently enabled (beaconing frames are being sent) or disabled.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.Enable}}.

parameter.name: LastChange
parameter.description:
Time in {{units}} since the last change to the {{param|Enabled}} value.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.SSID.{i}.LastChange}}.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: UnicastBytesSent
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total unicast bytes transmitted.

parameter.name: UnicastBytesReceived
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total unicast bytes received.

parameter.name: MulticastBytesSent
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total multicast bytes transmitted.

parameter.name: MulticastBytesReceived
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total multicast bytes received.

parameter.name: BroadcastBytesSent
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total broadcast bytes transmitted.

parameter.name: BroadcastBytesReceived
parameter.description: Access Point (BSS) wide statistics for total broadcast bytes received.

parameter.name: ByteCounterUnits
parameter.description:
Byte Counter Units.
: 1: kibibytes (KiB)
: 2: mebibytes (MiB).

parameter.name: Profile1bSTAsDisallowed
Profile2bSTAsDisallowed
AssociationAllowanceStatus
parameter.description:
The status of allowance of new client device associations on this BSS.
: 0: No more associations allowed,
: 1: Associations allowed.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersBE
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=BE, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersBK
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=BK, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersVI
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=VI, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: EstServiceParametersVO
parameter.description: Estimated Service Parameters information field for AC=VO, defined per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-637}} and referenced in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 17.2.22}}.

parameter.name: BackhaulUse
parameter.description:
Indicates that this BSS is in use as a backhaul BSS;
: {{true}}: backhaul BSS in use,
: {{false}}: backhaul BSS not in use.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is in use and 1 is not in use.

parameter.name: FronthaulUse
parameter.description:
Indicates that this BSS is in use as a fronthaul BSS;
: {{true}}: fronthaul BSS in use,
: {{false}}: fronthaul BSS not in use.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is in use and 1 is not in use.

parameter.name: R1disallowed
parameter.description:
Multi-AP Profile-1 [3] (R1) disallowed status.
: {{true}}: disallowed,
: {{false}}: allowed.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is allowed and 1 is disallowed.

parameter.name: R2disallowed
parameter.description:
Multi-AP Profile-2 [3] (R2) disallowed status.
: {{true}}: disallowed,
: {{false}}: allowed.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}} 0 is allowed and 1 is disallowed.

parameter.name: MultiBSSID
parameter.description:
Multiple BSSID Set;
: {{true}}: configured,
: {{false}}: not-configured.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}}, 1 is configured and 0 is not-configured.

parameter.name: TransmittedBSSID
parameter.description:
Transmitted BSSID;
: {{true}}: transmitted,
: {{false}}: non-transmitted.
In {{bibref|EasyMesh}}, 1 is transmitted and 0 is non-transmitted.

parameter.name: FronthaulAKMsAllowed
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate Authentication and Key Management (AKM) suites/security modes allowed at this BSS for fronthaul. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: "psk" indicates one or more of the PSK and FT-PSK AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:2" for interoperability.
"dpp" indicates one or more of the DPP and FT-DPP AKMs defined in {{bibref|EasyConnect|Section 8.4}}, typically at least "50-6F-9A:2" for interoperability.
"sae" indicates one or more of the SAE and FT-SAE AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:8" for interoperability.
"SuiteSelector" indicates an AKM suite selector, the value of which is indicated in {{param|FronthaulSuiteSelector}}.

parameter.name: FronthaulSuiteSelector
parameter.description:
AKM suite selector, the AKM suite selector (OUI and type) is encoded as a 4-octet hex-encoded value without internal delimiters, e.g. 506F9A02 {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}}.
This parameter applies if {{param|FronthaulAKMsAllowed}} includes value "SuiteSelector".

parameter.name: BackhaulAKMsAllowed
parameter.description: {{list}} List items indicate Authentication and Key Management (AKM) suites/security modes allowed at this BSS for backhaul. {{enum}}

enumeration.description: "psk" indicates one or more of the PSK and FT-PSK AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:2" for interoperability.
"dpp" indicates one or more of the DPP and FT-DPP AKMs defined in {{bibref|EasyConnect|Section 8.4}}, typically at least "50-6F-9A:2" for interoperability.
"sae" indicates one or more of the SAE and FT-SAE AKMs defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}} typically at least "00-0F-AC:8" for interoperability.
"SuiteSelector" indicates an AKM suite selector, the value of which is indicated in {{param|BackhaulSuiteSelector}}.

parameter.name: BackhaulSuiteSelector
parameter.description:
AKM suite selector, the AKM suite selector (OUI and type) is encoded as a 4-octet hex-encoded value without internal delimiters, e.g. 506F9A02 {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-151}}.
This parameter applies if {{param|BackhaulAKMsAllowed}} includes value "SuiteSelector".

parameter.name: BasicDataTransmitRates
parameter.description: {{list}} The current basic data rates; the set of data rates, in {{units}}, that have to be supported by all stations that desire to join this BSS. The stations have to be able to receive and transmit at each of the data rates listed in {{param}}. Most control packets use a data rate in {{param}}.

parameter.name: STANumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: QMDescriptorNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.QMDescriptor.{i}.
object.description: This object contains a table of {{param|DescriptorElement}}.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The BSSID of BSS for which this descriptor applies.

parameter.name: ClientMAC
parameter.description: MAC address of STA for which this descriptor applies.

parameter.name: DescriptorElement
parameter.description:
The descriptor element. One of:
: MSCS descriptor element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.243}}, or
: SCS descriptor element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.121}}, or
: QoS Management DSCP policy element (as described in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.94}} and {{bibref|RFC8325|Section 6.3}}).

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.MultiAPRadio.
object.description: This object represents an individual Access Point Radio in the Wi-Fi network.

parameter.name: RadarDetections
parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent channels in the non-occupancy list due to radars detected by Dynamic Frequency Selection (DFS) Channel Availability Check (CAC).

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.MUConfig.
object.description: This object provides Multiuser (MU)-specific BSS configuration.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.MUStats.
object.description: This object provides packet statistics for a Multiuser (MU) BSS.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.MultiAPSteering.
object.description: A single logical Access Point operating on this radio.

parameter.name: BlacklistAttempts
parameter.description:
Number of times a Blacklist steer was attempted for this Access Point.
Blacklist steering is the process of forcing a connected STA to move to another Access Point by temporarily blocking its access to the current Access Point.

parameter.name: BTMAttempts
parameter.description: Number of times a BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11-2020|sections 4.3.19.3 and 6.3.57}} steer was attempted for this Access Point.

parameter.name: BTMQueryResponses

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.WPS.
object.description: This object contains Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) Push Button Configuration (PBC) configuration and status as specified in {{bibref|WPSv1.0}} or {{bibref|WPS 2.0}}). In EasyMesh {{bibref|EasyMesh}} this object applies to fronthaul only.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables WPS functionality for this EasyMesh agent or single AP.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Indicates the current status of WPS. If the device goes to {{enum|SetupLocked}} the WPS needs to be disabled and re-enabled to come out of this state.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.ThroughputTestResult.
object.description: Object containing the results of the most recent throughput (speed) test from the BSS to a station (STA).

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: Timestamp for the throughput test, indicating when the test completed.

parameter.name: ClientMAC
parameter.description: MAC address of the STA that the throughput test ran to.

parameter.name: VID
parameter.description:
The VLAN ID (VID) that the throughput test ran on.
A value of 0 indicates that no VLAN was specified.

parameter.name: WMMUP
TestDuration
parameter.description: Duration of the throughput test in {{units}}.

parameter.name: TestLayer
parameter.description: The OSI layer that the throughput test ran on.

parameter.name: TestAlgorithm
parameter.description: The test algorithm that the throughput test used.

parameter.name: DownlinkSpeed
parameter.description: Downlink speed found by the throughput test in {{units}}.

parameter.name: UplinkSpeed
parameter.description: Uplink speed found by the throughput test in {{units}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.LatencyTestResult.
object.description: Object containing the results of the most recent latency test set from the BSS to a station (STA). Each latency test set includes a number of individual echo tests. Each echo test result provides a sample of round-trip times and statistics on all the echo tests in this latency test are reported in this object.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: Timestamp for the latency test, indicating when the last echo in the latency test set was received or timed-out.

parameter.name: ClientMAC
parameter.description: MAC address of the station (STA) or EasyMesh Agent that the latency test ran to.

parameter.name: VID
parameter.description:
The VLAN ID (VID) that the latency test ran on.
A value of 0 indicates that no VLAN was specified.

parameter.name: WMMUP
DataBlockSize
parameter.description:
The size of each data block, in {{units}}, that was transmitted in each echo test. The data block excludes the packet or frame header.
A value of 0 indicates that no DataBlockSize was specified.

parameter.name: TestLayer
parameter.description: The OSI layer that the latency test ran on.

parameter.name: TestAlgorithm
parameter.description: The test algorithm that the latency test used.

parameter.name: SuccessCount
parameter.description:
The number of successfully received echo responses.
This parameter is an output of the latency test.

parameter.name: LostCount
parameter.description:
The number of lost echoes in the latency test set.
This parameter is an output of the latency test.

parameter.name: AverageResponseTime
parameter.description:
The average round-trip time of the results of the latency test set in {{units}}. This average is across successfully received echoes only.
This parameter is an output of the latency test.

parameter.name: MinimumResponseTime
parameter.description:
The minimum round-trip time of the results of the latency test set in {{units}}. This minimum is across successfully received echoes only.
This parameter is an output of the latency test.

parameter.name: MaximumResponseTime
parameter.description:
The maximum round-trip time of the results of the latency test set in {{units}}. This maximum is across successfully received echoes only.
This parameter is an output of the latency test.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.STA.{i}.
object.description: Object describing a single Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description:
The MAC address of an associated device.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.MACAddress}}.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this group was collected. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: HTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the HT capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: VHTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the VHT capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: HECapabilities
ClientCapabilities
parameter.description: The frame body of the most recently received (Re)Association Request frame from this client (STA), as defined in Table 9-34 and Table 9-36 of {{bibref|802.11-2020}} in the order of the underlying referenced standard.

parameter.name: LastDataDownlinkRate
parameter.description:
The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the access point to the associated device.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.LastDataDownlinkRate}}.

parameter.name: LastDataUplinkRate
parameter.description:
The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the associated device to the access point.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.LastDataUplinkRate}}.

parameter.name: UtilizationReceive
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the Radio has spent on the Channel receiving data from this Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: UtilizationTransmit
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the Radio has spent on the Channel transmitting data to this Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: EstMACDataRateDownlink
parameter.description: Estimate of the MAC layer throughput in {{units}} achievable in the downlink direction if 100% of channel airtime and BSS operating bandwidth were available, as defined in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}.

parameter.name: EstMACDataRateUplink
parameter.description: Estimate of the MAC layer throughput in {{units}} achievable in the uplink direction if 100% of channel airtime and BSS operating bandwidth were available, as defined in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description:
An indicator of radio signal strength of the uplink from the associated STA to the access point - measured in {{units}}. RCPI is encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}, and described in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}). Reserved: 221 - 255.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.SignalStrength}}.

parameter.name: LastConnectTime
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} since this Assocated Device (STA) was associated.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description:
The total number of bytes transmitted to the Associated Device.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.BytesSent}}.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description:
The total number of bytes received from the Associated Device.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.BytesReceived}}.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description:
The total number of packets transmitted to the Associated Device.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.PacketsSent}}.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description:
The total number of packets received from the Associated Device.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.PacketsReceived}}.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description:
The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. These might be due to the number of retransmissions exceeding the retry limit, or from other causes.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.ErrorsSent}}.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description:
The total number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.ErrorsReceived}}.

parameter.name: RetransCount
parameter.description:
The total number of transmitted packets which were retransmissions. Two retransmissions of the same packet results in this counter incrementing by two.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Stats.RetransCount}}.

parameter.name: MeasurementReport
parameter.description: {{list}} Measurement Report element(s) received from the Associated Device (STA) that constitute the latest Beacon report as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Figure 9-230}}.

parameter.name: NumberOfMeasureReports
parameter.description: The number of measurement report elements contained in {{param|MeasurementReport}}.

parameter.name: IPV4Address
parameter.description: IPV4 Address assigned to the client.

parameter.name: IPV6Address
parameter.description: IPV6Address assigned to the client.

parameter.name: Hostname
parameter.description: Hostname assigned to the client.

parameter.name: CellularDataPreference
ReAssociationDelay
parameter.description: Re-association Delay {{bibref|AMB}}. The time, in {{units}}, after a BTM steer from AP1 to AP2 during which the station cannot go back and re-associate with AP1.

parameter.name: SleepMode
parameter.description: This parameter indicates the current operating sleep mode as recorded by the BSS {{bibref|802.11-2020}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: SecurityAssociation
parameter.description: This parameter indicates the current operating security state as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 12.6.1.1}}. {{enum}}

parameter.name: TIDQueueSizesNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.STA.{i}.MultiAPSTA.
object.description:
The summary of statistics and operations for an individual STA on the Wi-Fi network.
The counters contained in {{object}} are all reset on reboot.

parameter.name: AssociationTime
parameter.description:
Date and time in UTC when the device was associated.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.AssociationTime}}.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description:
An indicator of the average radio noise plus interference power measured on the uplink from the Associated Device (STA) to the Access Point (AP).
Encoded as defined for ANPI in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 11.10.9.4}}.
If the instance of this {{object}} is the same as {{object|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.}}, then this parameter is the same as {{param|Device.WiFi.AccessPoint.{i}.AssociatedDevice.{i}.Noise}}.

parameter.name: SteeringHistoryNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.STA.{i}.MultiAPSTA.SteeringSummaryStats.
object.description:
The summary of statistics related to Multi-AP Steering for this STA on the Wi-Fi network.
The counters contained in {{object}} are all reset on reboot.

parameter.name: NoCandidateAPFailures
parameter.description: Number of times this Associated Device should have been steered but wasn't because a better candidate AP couldn't be found.

parameter.name: BlacklistAttempts
parameter.description: Number of times a Blacklist steer was attempted on this Associated Device.

parameter.name: BlacklistSuccesses
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted Blacklist steer succeeded for this Associated Device.

parameter.name: BlacklistFailures
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted Blacklist steer failed for this Associated Device.

parameter.name: BTMAttempts
parameter.description: Number of times a BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) steer was attempted on this Associated Device.

parameter.name: BTMSuccesses
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) steer succeeded for this Associated Device.

parameter.name: BTMFailures
parameter.description: Number of times an attempted BTM (BSS Transition Management; {{bibref|802.11k}}) steer failed for this Associated Device.

parameter.name: BTMQueryResponses
LastSteerTime
parameter.description: The number of {{units}} since this Associated Device was last attempted to be steered.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.STA.{i}.MultiAPSTA.SteeringHistory.{i}.
object.description:
The history of Multi-AP Steering for this STA on the Wi-Fi network.
The contents of this multi-instance object are reset on reboot.

parameter.name: Time
parameter.description: The date/time when steering was initiated for the Associated Device.

parameter.name: APOrigin
parameter.description: The BSSID of the Access Point that initiated the steering.

parameter.name: TriggerEvent
parameter.description:
The type of event that caused the steering to be initiaited. {{enum}}
NOTE: This might be Unknown for BTM Query Response steers.

parameter.name: SteeringApproach
parameter.description: The type of steering that was attempted. {{enum}}

parameter.name: APDestination
parameter.description:
The BSSID of the destination Access Point of a successful steer.
A failed steering attempt will leave this parameter {{empty}}.

parameter.name: SteeringDuration
parameter.description:
The amount of time in {{units}} required for the steer to complete successfully.
A failed steering attempt will leave this parameter 0.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.STA.{i}.WiFi6Capabilities.
object.description: Describes the Wi-Fi 6 capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.BSS.{i}.STA.{i}.TIDQueueSizes.{i}.
object.description: Object describing Traffic Identifiers (TIDs), and Queue Size for each TID, for this Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: TID
parameter.description: The TID of the corresponding Queue Size field.

parameter.name: Size
parameter.description: Queue Size for this TID. Its format is defined in Table 9-10-QoS Control field {{bibref|802.11-2020}}.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.Network.Device.{i}.Radio.{i}.UnassociatedSTA.{i}.
object.description: Each instance represents a station (STA) that has been discovered by the Radio but is not associated to any of the BSS operating on the Radio.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the Non-AP STA.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength (RCPI) of the uplink from the Non-AP STA - measured in {{units}}. RCPI is encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}, and described in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.2}}. Reserved: 221 - 255.

parameter.name: OperatingClass
parameter.description: Operating class on which this unassociated STA was last detected, per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}}.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: Channel on which this unassociated STA was last detected.

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.AssociationEvent.
object.description: This object contains the events generated when a STA associates to a BSS.

parameter.name: AssociationEventDataNumberOfEntries
parameter.description:
{{numentries}}
{{deprecated|2.17|because a corresponding USP event is defined instead}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.AssociationEvent.AssociationEventData.{i}.
Device.WiFi.DataElements.AssociationEvent.AssociationEventData.{i}.WiFi6Capabilities.
object.description:
Describes the Wi-Fi 6 capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).
{{deprecated|2.17|because a corresponding USP event is defined instead}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.DisassociationEvent.
object.description: This object contains the events generated when an Associated Device (STA) disassociates from a BSS.

parameter.name: DisassociationEventDataNumberOfEntries
parameter.description:
{{numentries}}
{{deprecated|2.17|because a corresponding USP event is defined instead}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.DisassociationEvent.DisassociationEventData.{i}.
Device.WiFi.DataElements.FailedConnectionEvent.
object.description: This object contains the events generated when a Station (STA) fails to connect to a Basic Service Set (BSS).

parameter.name: FailedConnectionEventDataNumberOfEntries
parameter.description:
{{numentries}}
{{deprecated|2.17|because a corresponding USP event is defined instead}}

object.name: Device.WiFi.DataElements.FailedConnectionEvent.FailedConnectionEventData.{i}.
object.description:
This object describes the data provided with a failed connection event
{{deprecated|2.17|because a corresponding USP event is defined instead}}

parameter.name: OpClassScanNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: ChannelScanNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

parameter.name: NeighborBSSNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: ScanResult.{i}.
object.description: The list of neighboring Access Points discovered by a Radio organized per Operating Class and Channel tuple.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The timestamp of the last scan. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: AggregateScanDuration
parameter.description: Total time spent performing the scan of this channel in {{units}}.

parameter.name: ScanType
parameter.description: Indicates whether the scan was performed passively (false) or with active probing (true).

object.name: ScanResult.{i}.OpClassScan.{i}.
object.description: The Operating Class of neighboring Access Points discovered by a Radio during a channel scan.

parameter.name: OperatingClass
parameter.description:
The Operating Class per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table E-4}} of the OpClass and Channel tuple scanned by the Radio. For 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands, only 20MHz Operating Classes are valid.
Note that the Operating Class identifies the band and channel width.

object.name: ScanResult.{i}.OpClassScan.{i}.ChannelScan.{i}.
object.description: The Channel associated with an Operating Class of neighboring Access Points discovered by a Radio during a channel scan.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.description: The channel number of the Channel scanned by the Radio given the Operating Class.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The timestamp of the last scan of the channel. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: Utilization
parameter.description: The current Channel Utilization measured by the Radio on the scanned 20MHz channel, as defined by {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.27}}.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description:
An indicator of the average radio noise plus interference power measured for the primary operating channel.
Encoded as defined for ANPI in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 11.10.9.4}}.

parameter.name: ScanStatus
parameter.description: Status code to indicate whether a scan has been performed and if not the reason for failure {{enum}}

enumeration.description: Scan not supported on this opclass and channel
Request too soon after last scan
Radio too busy to perform scan
Fresh scan not supported, radio only supports on boot scans

object.name: ScanResult.{i}.OpClassScan.{i}.ChannelScan.{i}.NeighborBSS.{i}.
object.description: The neighboring BSS discovered by a Radio during a channel scan.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The BSSID indicated by the neighboring BSS.

parameter.name: SSID
parameter.description: The SSID indicated by the neighboring BSS.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength (RSSI) of the Beacon or Probe Response frames of the neighboring BSS as received by the radio measured in {{units}}. (RSSI is encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}). Reserved: 221 - 255.

parameter.name: ChannelBandwidth
parameter.description: Indicates the maximum bandwidth at which the neighboring BSS is operating. e.g. "20" or "40" or "80" or "80+80" or "160" MHz.

parameter.name: ChannelUtilization
parameter.description: The channel utilization reported by the neighboring BSS per the BSS Load element if present in Beacon or Probe Response frames, as defined by {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.27}}.

parameter.name: StationCount
parameter.description: The number of Associated Devices (STA) reported by this neighboring BSS per the BSS Load element if present in Beacon or Probe Response frames as defined by {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.27}}.

parameter.name: MLDMACAddress
parameter.description: The Multi-Link Device (MLD) MAC address of the Multi-Link Operation (MLO) capable access point this neighboring BSS is affiliated to. Null if the neighboring BSS is not an affiliated AP.

parameter.name: ReportingBSSID
parameter.description: The BSSID of the reporting BSSID if different from {{param|BSSID}}. This will be set if the NeigborBSS was discovered through, for example, a Reduced Neighbor Report. EasyMesh {{bibref|EasyMesh}} source: Channel Scan Result TLV.

parameter.name: MultiBSSID
parameter.description: Indicates if the neighboring BSS is part of a MultiBSSID set and may be a non-transmitted BSSID.

parameter.name: BSSLoadElementPresent
parameter.description: Set to true if the neighbour BSS Beacon/Probe Responses include a BSSLoad Element as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 9.4.2.28}}.

parameter.name: BSSColor
parameter.description: Set to the BSS Color from the BSS Color Information field in the BSS's HE Operation element.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this event happened. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the logical BSS (BSSID) which is reporting the Association Event.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: StatusCode
parameter.description: The status code sent to the Associated Device (STA) in the Association Response frame as defined by {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-50}}.

parameter.name: HTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the HT capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: VHTCapabilities
parameter.description: Describes the VHT capabilities of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: HECapabilities
ClientCapabilities
parameter.description: The frame body of the (Re)Association Request frame received from this client (STA), as defined in Table 9-34 and Table 9-36 of {{bibref|802.11-2020}} in the order of the underlying referenced standard.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the logical BSS (BSSID) which is reporting the Disassociation Event.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: ReasonCode
parameter.description: The Reason Code received by the AP from the Associated Device (STA) in the most recent Disassociation or Deauthentication frame or sent by the AP to the Associated Device (STA) in the most recent Disassociation or Deauthentication frame as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-49}}.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted to the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received from the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted to the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received from the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The total number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted to the Associated Device (STA) because of errors. These might be due to the number of retransmissions exceeding the retry limit or from other causes.

parameter.name: ErrorsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of inbound packets from the Associated Device (STA) that contained errors preventing them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol.

parameter.name: RetransCount
parameter.description:
The total number of transmitted packets to the Associated Device (STA) which were retransmissions.
N retransmissions of the same packet results in this counter incrementing by N.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this event happened. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.

parameter.name: LastDataDownlinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the access point to the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: LastDataUplinkRate
parameter.description: The data transmit rate in {{units}} that was most recently used for transmission of data from the Associated Device (STA) to the access point.

parameter.name: UtilizationReceive
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the Radio has spent on the Channel receiving data from the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: UtilizationTransmit
parameter.description: The amount of time in {{units}} that the Radio has spent on the Channel transmitting data to the Associated Device (STA).

parameter.name: EstMACDataRateDownlink
parameter.description: Estimate of the MAC layer throughput in {{units}} achievable in the downlink direction to the Associated Device (STA) if 100% of channel airtime and BSS operating bandwidth were available, as defined in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}.

parameter.name: EstMACDataRateUplink
parameter.description: Estimate of the MAC layer throughput in {{units}} achievable in the uplink direction from the Associated Device (STA) if 100% of channel airtime and BSS operating bandwidth were available, as defined in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}.

parameter.name: SignalStrength
parameter.description: An indicator of radio signal strength of the uplink from the Associated Device (STA) to the access point - measured in {{units}}. RCPI is encoded per {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-176}}, and described in {{bibref|EasyMesh|Section 10.3.1}}). Reserved: 221 - 255.

parameter.name: LastConnectTime
parameter.description: The time in {{units}} since this Assocated Device (STA) was associated.

parameter.name: Noise
parameter.description:
An indicator of the average radio noise plus interference power at the access point measured for the primary operating channel to this Associated Device (STA).
Encoded as defined for ANPI in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Section 11.10.9.4}}.

parameter.name: InitiatedBy
parameter.description: This parameter indicates the entity that initiated this Disassociation Event. {{enum}}

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: The MAC address of the affiliated STA whose link stats are being reported.

parameter.name: BytesSent
parameter.description: The total number of bytes transmitted to the affiliated STA.

parameter.name: BytesReceived
parameter.description: The total number of bytes received from the affiliated STA.

parameter.name: PacketsSent
parameter.description: The total number of packets transmitted to the affiliated STA.

parameter.name: PacketsReceived
parameter.description: The total number of packets received from the affiliated STA.

parameter.name: ErrorsSent
parameter.description: The number of packets which could not be transmitted to the affiliated STA because of errors.

parameter.name: BSSID
parameter.description: The MAC Address of the logical BSS (BSSID) which is reporting the failed connection event.

parameter.name: MACAddress
parameter.description: MAC Address identifying the associated device (STA) that has attempted to connect.

parameter.name: StatusCode
parameter.description: Status Code set to a non-zero value that indicates the reason for association or authentication failure as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-50}}, or Status Code set to zero and {{param|ReasonCode}} provided.

parameter.name: ReasonCode
parameter.description: Reason Code indicating the reason the STA was disassociated or deauthenticated as defined in {{bibref|802.11-2020|Table 9-49}}.

parameter.name: TimeStamp
parameter.description: The time this event happened. Formatted with the date-and-time string format as defined in {{bibref|RFC3339|Section 3}}.
